divs: sighting detailsat 7:00 p.m. last evening, i noticed three bright lights in the sky, east of the center of simsbury. they were moving very slowly, approx. east to west, traveling directly across the flight path to bradley international airport. when i first saw these lights i was driving north on route 10 & 202, and noticed them to my right. i made a right down wilcox street to get a better view and realized at that point there was something extremely anamolous about them, so i stopped and was able to watch them in a parking lot for a few minutes. they were moving very, very slowly. the light furthest to the east blinked out, and seconds later a jet liner was gliding in to bradley! by then the other two were well out of its way, however, the people seated on the left side of the jetliner would have had an excellent look what i was seeing. they were quite larger and brighter than stars, no comparison, pulsating blue\white light. they were not helocopters, since, 1.there was no noise, and, 2.there was no flashing red and green light which would have been absolutly required that close to the airport. in conclusion i grew up near the airport and have been watching planes and helocopters all of my life. i have seen military choppers flying in formation before, but military craft (blackhawks and chinooks around here) are really friggin' loud, and these afore mentioned craft were silent. i have also observed satelites, which are slightly brighter than stars to my knowledge, and move a bit more rapidly than what i witnessed. these were far brighter and, well, odder, than anything i have witnessed in my 44 years. goodnight and good luck.
Summary: 3 disc like objects over Simsbury CT.
